Detailed Description

Create Tapi-compliant devices with the help of this class Tapi::TapiClient.

Author
Tobias Holst
Version
2.1.1

Definition at line 68 of file tapi_client.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Tapi::TapiClient::TapiClient ( ros::NodeHandle *  nh,
std::string  nodename,
uint8_t  deviceType 
)

Create a TapiClient object as the helper to connect to the core of Tapi and create Tapi-compliant publishers/subscribers/serviceservers/serviceclients. Usually called by classes who inherits from Tapi::TapiClient.

Parameters
nhPointer to a ros::NodeHandle created outside of this class
nodenameName of the device
deviceTypeType of the device, 1 for a PUBLISHER_DEVICE, 2 for a SUBSCRIBER_DEVICE, 3 for a SERVICE_SERVER and 4 for a SERVICE_CLIENT

Definition at line 60 of file tapi_client.cpp.

Tapi::TapiClient::~TapiClient ( )

Shutdown the Hello-client and its heartbeat-thread and free the memory.

Member Function Documentation

bool Tapi::TapiClient::connect ( )
protected

Connect to the Hello-Service on /Tapi/HelloServ and send our device data.

Returns
true if connected successfully, false if not
See also
Hello.srv

Definition at line 87 of file tapi_client.cpp.

string Tapi::TapiClient::generateUUID ( )
protected

Generates a new unique id by using the uuid library and then convert it to a ros compatible string (underscores instead of dashes)

Returns
Unique ID as a ros compatible string

Definition at line 139 of file tapi_client.cpp.

string Tapi::TapiClient::getNextFeatureUUID ( )
protected

Get the next id of/for a feature.

It will use the ID from the config-file if there still is one. If not it will generate on and append it to the config file.

Returns
Next unique id for a feature as a ros compatible string
See also
Tapi::TapiClient::loadUUIDS

Definition at line 176 of file tapi_client.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiClient::heartbeat ( )
private

Sends regular Hello-service calls to keep the device state "alive".

Started in an extra (heartbeat-) thread. On failure it gives another try every WAIT_MS_ON_ERROR ms, on success it waits the configured heartbeat time for this device.

See also
Tapi::TapiClient::heartbeatThread
Tapi::TapiClient::connect
Tapi::TapiClient::heartbeatInterval

Definition at line 159 of file tapi_client.cpp.

Definition at line 198 of file tapi_client.cpp.

Member Data Documentation

uint8_t Tapi::TapiClient::deviceType
private

Store the type of the device.

It's 1 for PUBLISHER_DEVICE, 2 for SUBSCRIBER_DEVICE, 1 (=PUBLISHER_DEVICE) for SERVICE_SERVER and 2 (=SUBSCRIBER_DEVICE) for SERVICE_CLIENT

Definition at line 155 of file tapi_client.hpp.

std::vector<tapi_lib::Feature> Tapi::TapiClient::featureMsgs
protected

vector of Feature-messages to call the Hello-service

They are generated in the inherited classes and contain the information about the features.
